trans-unit.source: .w
trans-unit.target: .w

trans-unit.source: CodeChat transforms source code into a web page, allowing developers to view their program as a beautiful and descriptive document by adding headings, formatting, hyperlinks, diagrams, images, and other forms of rich content to capture the ideas and insights that naturally flow from the process of writing a program. It also provides a blank slate in which to plan ahead, by sketching out an algorithm before committing it to code or laying out a design document which can evolve as the code does. This literate programming paradigm changes the way developers think by intermingling ideas with their implementation as code, dramatically improving a programmer’s abilities.
trans-unit.target: CodeChat将源代码转换为网页，从而使开发人员可以通过添加标题，格式，超链接，图表，图像和其他形式的丰富内容来捕获其程序的漂亮描述性文档，以捕获自然而然的想法和见解。编写程序的过程。它还提供了一个空白的计划，可以在计划之前进行规划，方法是在将算法提交给代码之前先勾勒出一个算法，或者设计一个可以随着代码的发展而变化的设计文档。这种有文化素养的编程范例通过将思想与他们的实现以代码的形式混合在一起，从而改变了开发人员的思维方式，从而极大地提高了程序员的能力。

trans-unit.source: Put simply, literate programming (LP) is the realization that a program is a document written to and for fellow programmers, not simply a list of instructions for a computer. LP tools therefore produce a nicely-formatted document which contains the code intermixed with explanatory prose. Donald Knuth introduced literate programming using his WEB tool in his seminal paper. Per Figure 1 of this paper, the WEB system takes a
trans-unit.target: 简而言之，识字编程（LP）是一种实现，即程序是向其他程序员编写的文件，并且是为其他程序员编写的，而不仅仅是计算机的指令列表。因此，LP工具会产生格式精美的文档，其中包含与解释性散文混合在一起的代码。Donald Knuth在他的开创性论文中介绍了使用WEB工具进行识字编程的方法。每此的图1 纸，WEB系统需要

trans-unit.source: document as input then produces either a “tangled” source file for compilation or a “woven” document as a
trans-unit.target: 作为输入的文档，然后生成“纠结”的源文件进行编译，或者生成“编织的”文档作为

trans-unit.source: file. The document is beautiful; the WEB source is difficult to digest (see Figure 2a-c); the source code is completely unreadable (see Figure 3). While a plethora of tools developed over the years attempt to address these problems, only one LP-inspired variant has gained widespread acceptance: documentation generators, such as Doxygen and JavaDoc, which extract documentation directly from source code, rather than extracting source code from the documentation, as WEB and most LP tools do. CodeChat addresses these LP weaknesses by producing a document directly from the code; employing human-readable markup (reStructuredText); and by supporting a GUI to make editing an LP document-program faster and easier.
trans-unit.target: 文件。文件很漂亮。 WEB来源难以消化（见图2a-c）；源代码是完全不可读的（请参见图3）。尽管多年来开发了许多工具来解决这些问题，但只有一种受LP启发的变体获得了广泛的接受：文档生成器，例如Doxygen和JavaDoc，它们直接从源代码中提取文档，而不是从源代码中提取源代码。文档，就像WEB和大多数LP工具一样。 CodeChat通过直接从代码生成文档来解决这些LP弱点。采用人类可读的标记（reStructuredText）；并且通过支持GUI可以更快，更轻松地编辑LP文档程序。
